task_name: CUSTOM TO DO: A1C REVIEW NEW RESULT
trigger: New A1c has been manually added

steps.general: HC Create custom to do: ‘Follow up A1c due’ and schedule for 90 days since the collection date If new result is from LGC home kit: send a message to the participant with A1c results and instructions to log into the Athena Portal: *Thank you for completing the home A1c kit. Your A1c is (...).  You will receive a notification from our clinic team to view your result in your Athena patient portal. Note that variations in laboratory test results can occur from one lab to another so please let me know if you have any questions or concerns.  What are your thoughts about this A1c? You can access your Athena patient portal on your smartphone or your computer at [**16616.portal.athenahealth.com**](https://16616.portal.athenahealth.com/). When you first log in on your computer, don’t forget to bookmark the page so it’s easy to find next time.  Here’s how to use your Athena patient portal on your computer: To See Test Results Click My Health on the top left. Click Test Results in the top menu.* If A1c ≥ 8% create custom to do: A1c ≥ 8% and reassign to RN (Review RN’s name A1c ≥ 8% ) If Beta, document here: [VUS - LP Beta Tickets & Clinical Escalations ](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1QVjDzS7aA1_ztGMjArSYysgcGxFyfKZkn870pwOYbQY/edit?gid=0#gid=0)

triggering_criteria: New member assigned to the Care Team

steps.general: Send welcome message, include:  Your name Role Working hours Program overview Open-ended question re: motivation, goals or what kind of support they are looking for from the Lightpath program Example:  **Thread: Welcome to the Lightpath Program** *Hi, thank you for joining\! My name is (insert name) and I am looking forward to working with you.      Welcome to the Lightpath Program\! I will be your coach. I’m available Monday \- Friday and I usually respond within a couple business days.  Our program gives you access to tools and coaching to help you reach your health goals. A great way to start is by completing the surveys and missions on the home screen of your Verily Me app. This will help me to get to know you better and offer feedback. I’d also love to hear back from you here in the chat tab, what motivated you to join our program, and what would you like to focus on first? If you run into any issues please email care1support@verily.com or call 1-833-603-6667. Our support team is here Monday-Friday 9am \- 6pm EST.*   Complete onboarding steps: [Onboarding]() RN If you greet new member (and you are not assigned as a HC) \- create a custom to do for the HC: continue onboarding HC name

triggering_criteria: Prt has completed Diabetes Distress Score and ALL subscale score \<= 2.0

steps.general: Coach Review DDAS Survey Document any ‘serious/ very serious’ responses in the Care Plan and follow up with participant, as needed Average score \< 2.0 \= indicates little or no distress Average score between 2.0 and 2.9 \= indicates moderate distress Average score \> 3.0 \= indicates high distress Any total of subscale score \> 2.0 is considered clinically significant. Follow up in any categories \> 2.0 (i.e., moderate distress) Management Difficulties Hypoglycemia Concerns Interpersonal Challenges Healthcare Quality Shame Worries About Complications Financial Worries Lack of Diabetes Resources Technology Challenges Burden To Others [Lightpath Educational Content](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1-b5-XWl0l0HY1ly7AoBwX1jGzedOZ-PXXPNTH9KgbyU/edit?tab=t.t83fcms54zrx) [Health Plan Client Referrals](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/12UV9-cxXxKW-h8d2rbJ9GZNCY400hz6_A0oSB6_UdSs/edit?gid=1174979338#gid=1174979338)

triggering_criteria: Triggered when a member has had 1 or more \[BGM \< 54 mg/dL in the last 24 hours

steps.general: HC: RNs will search for this to do daily If RN hasn’t message the participant yet and the Rule of 15 has not been shared with participant yet, please send the Rule of 15 content card via separate message thread titled: Hypoglycemia Education  RN Review BG data, if available If confirmation on false low: participant re-checked within 5 minutes and reading was \>70, no action needed. Resolve to do.  Find out what might have caused hypos that can be avoided in the future. *We would like to support you with getting your glucose in a safe range. What do you feel may have caused the low blood glucose readings? Nos gustaría ayudar a que mantenga sus niveles de glucosa en un rango seguro. ¿A qué cree que se debieron los bajos niveles de glucosa?* Provide education on hypoglycemia symptoms and treatment  If wearing Dexcom instruct the participant to make sure the fall rate alarm is turned ON  [Lightpath Educational Content](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1-b5-XWl0l0HY1ly7AoBwX1jGzedOZ-PXXPNTH9KgbyU/edit?tab=t.rcfd7kpyzwr#heading=h.ml7uxljkdmtc) \- Monitoring → Hypoglycemia If PharmD is assigned to participant’s Care Team \- consider escalating for medication review
steps.non_clinic: RN Refer participant to local MD or offer Onduo PC visit if participant had no appointments within the past 2 weeks and no upcoming appointment within the next 2 weeks (especially if participant is on hypoglycemia causing medications) Add a Note in Lightpath: S: Symptoms/ causes O: BG:  A: NA P: No action needed OR plan/ goals for the HC
steps.clinic: RN Determine if Patient Case in Athena is needed: **No** patient case needed if: Confirmation of false low- participant re-checked within 5 minutes and reading was \>70  Resolve the TO DO (no note needed) **YES** Patient case in Athena is needed Check in about medications (is participant on Insulin/ Sulfonylurea):  If participant responded with info: Add to the ‘Current Medications’ section of patient case (within the macro)  If participant does not respond with info: Add to the ‘Current medications’ section of the patient case ‘No response from member about meds’ or ‘Member is not responding to messages’  [CS Athena Job Aid ](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1WwTMOMVY5IQw83Karzoj7158AnFFQx7CzpLULdBMXQc/edit#) Add a Note in Lightpath S: Symptoms/ causes O: BG:  A: NA P: Indicate that an Athena patient case was created \+ plan for HC (if applicable)

message_templates.template: We would like to support you with getting your glucose in a safe range. What do you feel may have caused the low blood glucose readings? Nos gustaría ayudar a que mantenga sus niveles de glucosa en un rango seguro. ¿A qué cree que se debieron los bajos niveles de glucosa?
patient case needed if: Confirmation of false low- participant re-checked within 5 minutes and reading was \>70  Resolve the TO DO (no note needed)

triggering_criteria: Triggered when a member has had 1 or more \[BGM \> 180 mg/dL in the last 24 hours\]

steps.general: HC Check for any higher priority BG triggers (BGM \- 100, 101, 104\) \- if these exists \- reassign this to do to RN If no higher BG triggers, follow the steps below: Educate participant about hyperglycemia, assess what might be causing high BG and set goals to lower BG, if applicable Encourage logging meals If no A1c \- [A1c & A1c LGC Kit]() [Offer CGM]() (if not offered yet) Set goals once identified specific time/ food/ activity when BG is high [NEW Draft Lightpath Educational Content](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1-b5-XWl0l0HY1ly7AoBwX1jGzedOZ-PXXPNTH9KgbyU/edit?tab=t.cx0jez7pifvh)

triggering_criteria: Triggered when a member has had 1 or more \[BGM \> 400 mg/dL in the last 24 hours\]

steps.general: HC NA (RNs will search for this to do daily)
steps.non_clinic: RN If a single reading is greater than 400 but there is a repeat reading within 5 minutes of \<180 in range no need to create a note. This task can be resolved. Educate on lifestyle factors impacting BG readings & hyperglycemia [NEW Draft Lightpath Educational Content](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1-b5-XWl0l0HY1ly7AoBwX1jGzedOZ-PXXPNTH9KgbyU/edit?tab=t.cx0jez7pifvh) Refer to local MD or offer MD Ref visit if needed
steps.clinic: RN Review BG data, if available  Ask about medication adherence *We would like to support you with getting your glucose readings into range. Can you share with me if you ever forget to take your medications? If yes, how often have you missed a dose in the last week?* Educate on lifestyle factors impacting BG readings & hyperglycemia [NEW Draft Lightpath Educational Content](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1-b5-XWl0l0HY1ly7AoBwX1jGzedOZ-PXXPNTH9KgbyU/edit?tab=t.cx0jez7pifvh) Review readings and check to see if member had a recent visit with Onduo MD to determine if a patient case is needed **No** patient case needed if: Participant has a visit scheduled with Onduo MD or Pharmacist in the next 7 days  Participant had a visit with Onduo MD or Pharmacist in the last 14 days and meds were adjusted  If a participant shares that they have not filled their Rx yet, no patient case is needed If single reading of greater than 400 but there is a repeat reading within 5 minutes of \<180 in range Resolve the to do (no note needed). **Yes** patient case is needed: create a ‘custom to do: follow up on trigger’ and schedule out 3 days  Once info has been collected from participant or it has been 3 days create the patient case in Athena and include any details you have for the MD If participant responded with info: Add to the ‘Current Medications’ section of patient case (within the macro) If member does not respond with info: Add to the ‘Current medications’ section of the patient case ‘No response from member about meds’ or ‘Member is not responding to messages’  Add a Note in Lightpath S: Symptoms/ causes O: BG:  A: NA P: Indicate that an Athena patient case was created and no action needed or a ‘plan’ for the HC with specific recommendations. [CS Athena Job Aid ](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1WwTMOMVY5IQw83Karzoj7158AnFFQx7CzpLULdBMXQc/edit#)

triggering_criteria: Triggered when a member has average BG \> 170 for the past 2 weeks and most recent verified A1c \< 7%

steps.general: HC First trigger: follow up with the member about numbers trending up and then resolve the task  *It looks like your blood glucose numbers may be going up. I am here to support you with this\!  When looking at BG patterns it can be helpful to check your BG every day and two hours after meals or snacks. What times of the day would you be willing to check your BG for the next week? Parece que sus niveles de glucemia están subiendo. Estamos aquí para brindarle ayuda.*  *Cuando observa patrones de glucemia, puede ser útil revisarla todos los días y dos horas después de las comidas o de un bocadillo* *¿A qué horas del día prefiere controlar su glucemia durante la próxima semana? * Second trigger or more:  Help the participant figure out what might be causing their numbers to go up Follow up on goals  [NEW Draft Lightpath Educational Content](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1-b5-XWl0l0HY1ly7AoBwX1jGzedOZ-PXXPNTH9KgbyU/edit?tab=t.cx0jez7pifvh)

task_name: REMIND MEMBER TO TAKE INITIAL BP READING

steps.general: Send message *I see you haven't taken your first blood pressure reading yet. Regular self-monitoring is an essential component of managing hypertension. Once you start monitoring, I’ll be able to see your progress instantly in the app, which means I can give you personalized tips and education exactly when you need it. Would you be open to taking your first reading today?*  Content card options:  Tips for Taking Your Blood Pressure Troubleshooting: Reasons Your Blood Pressure Reading Might Not Be Right

triggering_criteria: 3 or more BP readings ≥130/80 in the past 14 days

steps.general: Review Technique (send suggested wording or content card from below) Send message: *Great job checking your blood pressure\!  Little things can make a big difference in getting accurate readings. Here are some things to double check to support your efforts.  1 )  Are you sitting for 5 minutes before checking?  Gift yourself 5 minutes of calm breathing to thank yourself for your hard work  2\) Is your arm with the cuff at heart height, such as on a pillow on a table in front of you? \* (not arm at your side)\* 3\) Are both feet on the floor? Is your back supported? 4\) Is the tube on the inside of your arm?  Are any of these new for you?*  *Ha hecho un gran trabajo en la medición de su presión arterial* *Las acciones pequeñas pueden hacer una gran diferencia en la obtención de lecturas precisas. Estos son algunos aspectos a los que debe prestar atención para que sus esfuerzos tengan buenos resultados.*   *1\)  ¿Se sienta durante 5 minutos antes de medir su presión?  Dedique 5 minutos a respirar con calma y agradecerse por su gran trabajo.*  *2\) ¿Tiene el brazo con el brazalete puesto a la altura del corazón, por ejemplo, sobre una almohada en una mesa frente a usted?* *\*(no está con el brazo al lado).\** *3\) ¿Tiene ambos pies en el suelo? ¿Tiene la espalda apoyada en el respaldo?* *4\) ¿El tubo está en el lado interior de su brazo?*  *¿No conocía alguna de estas sugerencias?*   [Content card](https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1UIT5rtycZ2FGuBKMEXFMKUCU7vGrxret) options:  Tips for Taking Your Blood Pressure Troubleshooting: Reasons Your Blood Pressure Reading Might Not Be Right If the task continues to trigger it can be resolved but continue to follow up on: Technique  Lifestyle (DASH, FITT Plan, etc) [Lightpath Educational Content](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1-b5-XWl0l0HY1ly7AoBwX1jGzedOZ-PXXPNTH9KgbyU/edit?tab=t.rcfd7kpyzwr) Goal setting  Discussing when their next doctor's visit is and/or encouraging them to reach out to doctor  \*Note: Members should not be offered an MD Ref visit at this point. 130/80 does not make them eligible for an MD Ref visit.

message_templates.template: Great job checking your blood pressure\!  Little things can make a big difference in getting accurate readings. Here are some things to double check to support your efforts.  1 )  Are you sitting for 5 minutes before checking?  Gift yourself 5 minutes of calm breathing to thank yourself for your hard work  2\) Is your arm with the cuff at heart height, such as on a pillow on a table in front of you? \
3\) Are both feet on the floor? Is your back supported? 4\) Is the tube on the inside of your arm?  Are any of these new for you?
Ha hecho un gran trabajo en la medición de su presión arterial

Las acciones pequeñas pueden hacer una gran diferencia en la obtención de lecturas precisas. Estos son algunos aspectos a los que debe prestar atención para que sus esfuerzos tengan buenos resultados.
1\)  ¿Se sienta durante 5 minutos antes de medir su presión?  Dedique 5 minutos a respirar con calma y agradecerse por su gran trabajo.
2\) ¿Tiene el brazo con el brazalete puesto a la altura del corazón, por ejemplo, sobre una almohada en una mesa frente a usted?
(no está con el brazo al lado).\
3\) ¿Tiene ambos pies en el suelo? ¿Tiene la espalda apoyada en el respaldo?
4\) ¿El tubo está en el lado interior de su brazo?
¿No conocía alguna de estas sugerencias?

Little things can make a big difference in getting accurate readings. Here are some things to double check to support your efforts.  1 )  Are you sitting for 5 minutes before checking?  Gift yourself 5 minutes of calm breathing to thank yourself for your hard work  2\) Is your arm with the cuff at heart height, such as on a pillow on a table in front of you? \* (not arm at your side)\* 3\) Are both feet on the floor? Is your back supported? 4\) Is the tube on the inside of your arm?  Are any of these new for you?*  *Ha hecho un gran trabajo en la medición de su presión arterial* *Las acciones pequeñas pueden hacer una gran diferencia en la obtención de lecturas precisas. Estos son algunos aspectos a los que debe prestar atención para que sus esfuerzos tengan buenos resultados.*   *1\)  ¿Se sienta durante 5 minutos antes de medir su presión?  Dedique 5 minutos a respirar con calma y agradecerse por su gran trabajo.*  *2\) ¿Tiene el brazo con el brazalete puesto a la altura del corazón, por ejemplo, sobre una almohada en una mesa frente a usted?* *\*(no está con el brazo al lado).\** *3\) ¿Tiene ambos pies en el suelo? ¿Tiene la espalda apoyada en el respaldo?* *4\) ¿El tubo está en el lado interior de su brazo?*  *¿No conocía alguna de estas sugerencias?*   [Content card](https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1UIT5rtycZ2FGuBKMEXFMKUCU7vGrxret) options:  Tips for Taking Your Blood Pressure Troubleshooting: Reasons Your Blood Pressure Reading Might Not Be Right If the task continues to trigger it can be resolved but continue to follow up on: Technique  Lifestyle (DASH, FITT Plan, etc) [Lightpath Educational Content](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1-b5-XWl0l0HY1ly7AoBwX1jGzedOZ-PXXPNTH9KgbyU/edit?tab=t.rcfd7kpyzwr) Goal setting  Discussing when their next doctor's visit is and/or encouraging them to reach out to doctor  \*Note: Members should not be offered an MD Ref visit at this point. 130/80 does not make them eligible for an MD Ref visit.  |

triggering_criteria: 3 or more BP readings ≥160/100 in the past 14 days

steps.general: HC NA (RNs will search for this to do daily)
steps.non_clinic: RN Consider referring the member for an Onduo PC visit Message member about trends  *The recent BP averages have been ….* or  *I am connecting with you about the readings of …. Los promedios de las mediciones recientes de presión arterial han sido…*o  *Me comunico con usted debido a las mediciones de…* Consider if readings are part of BP variation or average is above 160/100 Variation- start with technique language Trend- offer Telemedicine with Onduo PC  If high Stage 2/hx crisis- consider calling if no response with 3 days Calls: If no response: Call 2X asking member to see messages in app If talk on the phone:	 Inquire about technique Inquire about next MD visit Discuss severity of readings at categories if member seems unaware Lifestyle- inquire about goal
steps.clinic: RN Review readings and check to see if member had a recent visit with Onduo MD to determine if a patient case is needed **No** patient case needed if: Member has a visit scheduled with Onduo MD or Pharmacist in the next 7 days  Member had a visit with Onduo MD or Pharmacist in the last 14 days and meds were adjusted  If a member shares that they have not filled their Rx yet, no patient case is needed If a patient case is not needed resolve the task and add a note: O: BP trigger \[to do name\], note that this will not be sent to clinic \- visit on dd/mm/yy If a patient case is needed create in Athena and add a note: O: Name of clinical trigger task P: Indicate that an Athena patient case was created and no action needed or a ‘plan’ for the HC with specific recommendations.

steps.general: HC NA (RNs will search for this to do daily)
steps.non_clinic: RN Send safety message  *Hi, my name is \_\_\_\_\_.  I am a Registered Nurse on your Care team and an extra layer of support. Thank you for taking your blood pressures so you can monitor your trends.*  *The reading of \_\_\_ is very high.  We are concerned about you. When is the soonest you can recheck your blood pressure to see if it is still high?  If you are having unusual symptoms, such as a severe headache, chest pain, shortness of breath, difficulty speaking or thinking, call 911 or your local emergency response team.  If you don’t have any symptoms, please let your primary care provider know about your high readings  Do you have any heart conditions? What are your thoughts or questions? Please let us know that you received this message. I may be calling you from 1-833-446-6386 if I don’t hear from you. Please save this number in your phone.*  *Hola, soy \_\_\_\_\_,  especialista en atención médica y le brindaré asistencia adicional. Gracias por realizar mediciones de su presión arterial para supervisar sus tendencias.*  *La medición de \_\_\_ es muy alta.  Nos preocupa su salud. ¿Qué tan pronto puede volver a medir su presión arterial para ver si continúa siendo alta?*  *Si experimenta síntomas atípicos, como dolor de cabeza intenso, dolor de pecho o dificultad para respirar, hablar o pensar, llame al 911 o al equipo local de servicios de emergencia.*  *Si no tiene síntomas, informe a su proveedor de atención primaria sobre sus mediciones altas.*   *¿Tiene alguna enfermedad cardíaca?* *¿Tiene alguna inquietud o pregunta?* *Indíquenos si recibió este mensaje. Es posible que me comunique con usted desde el número 1-833-446-6386 si no recibo una respuesta suya. Guarde este número en su teléfono.*  If member read message, no to need to call them Document as a note If member did not view message, phone call is needed Your choice to call immediately or in 2 hours Document call details as a note Note if a member has a PCP listed or unlisted if member is not responding or resistant to care  If member cannot get a “sick day” appt at either PCP or Cardiology- consider calling cardiology or PCP to leave message that member needs assistance and the related BP readings This is particularly a step to consider if repeat crisis readings over days that are verified for technique and you have been in communication with the member who has not been able to get care Document time of call to cardiology/PCP and the nurse/employee you spoke with Optional: Send content card Your Blood Pressure: When to Call 911 Consider reviewing BP technique
steps.clinic: RN Send safety message   *Hi, my name is \_\_\_\_\_.  I am a Care Specialist and an extra layer of support. Thank you for taking your blood pressures so you can monitor your trends. If you are seeing one of the Onduo providers, we will make them aware of your readings. The reading of \_\_\_ is very high and we are concerned about you. When is the soonest you can recheck your blood pressure to see if it is still high?              If you ARE having unusual symptoms, such as a severe headache, chest pain, shortness of breath, difficulty speaking or thinking, call 911 or your local emergency response team.  If your recheck number is still out of range and you do NOT have any symptoms, I will update our clinic team. What are your thoughts or questions? Please let us know that you received this message. I may be calling you from 1-833-446-6386 if I don’t hear from you. Please save this number in your phone.  Hola, soy \_\_\_\_\_,  especialista en atención médica y le brindaré asistencia adicional. Gracias por realizar mediciones de su presión arterial para supervisar sus tendencias.*  *Si se atiende con alguno de los proveedores de Onduo, le informaremos a este sobre sus mediciones.* *La medición de \_\_\_ es muy alta.  Nos preocupa su salud. ¿Qué tan pronto puede volver a medir su presión arterial para ver si continúa siendo alta?*  *Si experimenta síntomas atípicos, como dolor de cabeza intenso, dolor de pecho o dificultad para respirar, hablar o pensar, llame al 911 o al equipo local de servicios de emergencia.*  *Si el número que indica su nueva medición todavía se encuentra fuera de rango y NO tiene ningún síntoma, informaré a nuestro equipo clínico.*  *¿Tiene alguna inquietud o pregunta?* *Indíquenos si recibió este mensaje.Es posible que me comunique con usted desde el número 1-833-446-6386 si no recibo una respuesta suya. Guarde este número en su teléfono.*  If member read message, no to need to call them Document asa note If member did not view message, phone call is needed Your choice to call immediately or in 2 hours Document call details as a note Create patient case in Athena to notify the Onduo MD If the member is not responding to message please note in the case  Optional: Send content card Your Blood Pressure: When to Call 911 Add a note: Name of trigger Msg member in app:  Phone call time: Member response: Indicate if ‘plan for HC’ is needed  Consider reviewing BP technique

triggering_criteria: Any 1 reading \< 90/60

steps.general: HC NA (RNs will search for this to do daily)
steps.non_clinic: RN Only need to address if both systolic and diastolic are low below 90/60.  If both are below 90/60:  Send safety message to member  *Hi, my name is \_\_\_\_. triggering_criteria: A1c for prt \> 7.0%

steps.general: HC A1c \>7% \<9% Educate on ADA A1c guidelines for people with diabetes  Educate on lifestyle factors impacting BG readings & hyperglycemia [NEW Draft Lightpath Educational Content](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1-b5-XWl0l0HY1ly7AoBwX1jGzedOZ-PXXPNTH9KgbyU/edit?tab=t.cx0jez7pifvh) A1c \> 9 reassign to RN (Review RN’s name A1c \>9) beta :[VUS - LP Beta Tickets & Clinical Escalations ](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1QVjDzS7aA1_ztGMjArSYysgcGxFyfKZkn870pwOYbQY/edit?gid=0#gid=0)
steps.non_clinic: RN Educate on lifestyle factors impacting BG readings & hyperglycemia [NEW Draft Lightpath Educational Content](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1-b5-XWl0l0HY1ly7AoBwX1jGzedOZ-PXXPNTH9KgbyU/edit?tab=t.cx0jez7pifvh) Refer to local MD or offer MD Ref visit if needed
steps.clinic: RN Review BG data, if available  Ask about medication adherence Educate/ review: lifestyle factors impacting BG readings and hyperglycemia Determine if patient case is needed:  **No** patient case needed if: Participant has a visit scheduled with Onduo MD or Pharmacist in the next 7 days  Participant had a visit with Onduo MD or Pharmacist in the last 14 days and meds were adjusted  If a participant shares that they have not filled their Rx yet, no patient case is needed If single reading of greater than 400 but there is a repeat reading within 5 minutes of \<180 in range Resolve the to do (no note needed). **Yes** patient case is needed: create a ‘custom to do: follow up on trigger’ and schedule out 3 days  Once info has been collected from participant or it has been 3 days create the patient case in Athena and include any details you have for the MD If participant responded with info (re: medication): Add to the ‘Current Medications’ section of patient case (within the macro) If member does not respond with info: Add to the ‘Current medications’ section of the patient case ‘No response from member about meds’ or ‘Member is not responding to messages’  Add a Note in Lightpath S: Symptoms/ causes O: BG:  A: NA P: Indicate that an Athena patient case was created and no action needed or a ‘plan’ for the HC with specific recommendations. [CS Athena Job Aid ](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1WwTMOMVY5IQw83Karzoj7158AnFFQx7CzpLULdBMXQc/edit#)

message_templates.template: patient case needed if: Participant has a visit scheduled with Onduo MD or Pharmacist in the next 7 days  Participant had a visit with Onduo MD or Pharmacist in the last 14 days and meds were adjusted  If a participant shares that they have not filled their Rx yet, no patient case is needed If single reading of greater than 400 but there is a repeat reading within 5 minutes of \<180 in range Resolve the to do (no note needed).

steps.general: **For External Visits:**  If not already noted, can ask the participant what type of doctor they are seeing (endo, PCP, cardiologist, etc). | STEPS | HC Review Promis-10 Survey Document any ‘fair/ poor’ responses in the Care Plan and follow up with participant, as needed [Lightpath Educational Content](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1-b5-XWl0l0HY1ly7AoBwX1jGzedOZ-PXXPNTH9KgbyU/edit?tab=t.t83fcms54zrx) |

task_name: Prt selects answer 1, 2, or 3 on PHQ-9, question 9 self harm
full_text:
| PHQ-9 | Prt selects answer 1, 2, or 3 on PHQ-9, question 9 self harm |
| Registered Dietitian Nutritionist (RDN) visits  **At this time \- do not refer HMK members to an RD** | If member needs to change an appointment with the RDN: escalate to Robin Redd If member has had RDN visit and has questions for the RDN If no follow up scheduled: Escalate to Robin Redd  If follow up is scheduled: Make a note in the console with details (copy and paste member message) and task Robin. Robin will add a note to Athena so that she can address the question at the next visit Send message to member: *Thank you for letting me know your question. I see you have a follow up with your dietitian Robin on* (insert date)*. I have left her a note about this so that she can address it with you at your next appointment.* **Note:** At this time the RDN is only supporting members who have been referred to her by Onduo PC. Unless a member: Specifically asks about seeing a dietitian or  If someone answers:  **"somewhat confident" or "not at all confident"** to “**How confident are you about making food choices** to manage your weight”  **AND**  if they answer **“I eat out most of my meals**” create a custom to do: Review Robin and reassign to RD (if she is listed under member’s Care team) and create a note for RD to reference on why this to-do is being sent to her   However, please do not tell the member you are checking with the RDN until you have heard back from Robin on whether or not she can assist. **Weight loss program escalation key words:** Skipping meals, fasting, keto, intermittent fasting, liquid diet, etc create a custom to do: Review Robin and reassign to RD  |
| Member Reported Illness | Member reported illness or symptoms. For example:  Fever or feeling feverish (chills, sweating) Nausea, vomiting, or diarrhea Cold or flu-like symptoms (muscle or body aches) Headache that is not sudden/severe **For clinic members:**  Escalate to the RN and they will task the MA to notify the MD  For emergency situations refer to [Medical/Mental Health Emergency protocol](https://docs.google.com/document/u/0/d/1_64E5wRsRIt6fsUYOqyfnOoyMVsk9EBozwBXjwH4GaM/edit).  **If non clinic member:** Direct the member to seek medical care |
| Member Request or Need | Member requests to speak to RN, RDN,  PharmD or MD To speak with RN, RDN, PharmD escalate to them directly To speak to MD follow the instructions below:  **If clinic member:**  Instruct the member to send a message via the Athena Patient Portal. The clinic team can triage who the message goes to. Send content card ‘Use This Link to Access Your Onduo Patient Portal with Athena’ **If non clinic member:** Encourage members to reach out to PCP for recommendations. Escalate to RN if support is needed.  |
| Member reports any cardiac testing or cardiac conditions | If a member mentions having cardiac testing or cardiac conditions such as a stress test, halter, ultrasound, cardiac cath, stent, bypass, A-fib, stent, aneurysm, MI, stroke or Echo.   Escalate to RN  |
| Member reports having gastric bypass or weight procedure  | If member mentions having gastric bypass surgery or any type of weight procedure: Escalate to RN |
| Member requests visit with Endocrinologist  | If a member requests to have a video visit/establish care with an Endocrinologist specifically: Escalate to RN  RN will enter patient case in Athena and the clinic team will communicate with the member directly to get them manually scheduled with an Endocrinologist  Note: this is an escalation ONLY for the one off use cases where a member requests this. It is not something we should be offering proactively to members. Generally, we should be offering a visit with a physician and sending a Yosi link. This escalation is only if the member notices only internists are available and they are asking for Endo.  *Thank you for letting me know you would like to see an Endocrinologist. A member of our clinic team will be reaching out to support you with getting that scheduled. Please be on the lookout for communication from them via email.*  |
| Replacement LGC A1c  kit needed  | [A1c & A1C LGC kit → Replacement A1c kits]()  |
| Personal representative Authorization  | When a non-member contacts the care or support team on behalf of a member for any kind of inquiry, the member will need to complete the Personal Representative Authorization Form.  HC Task RN to open a patient case in Athena requesting the link to the personal representative auth form be sent to the member via Yosi  Communication to member Let the person communicating know that the member needs to sign this form to provide consent for them to communicate with us for them. Until that form is completed we cannot communicate with anyone other than the member.  *Thank you for letting me know that you would like* (insert name) *to communicate on your behalf in the program. We can certainly accommodate that request. However, we need you to sign a personal representative authorization form in order to give us permission to speak to them on your behalf. Please be on the lookout for an email notification to complete the form within 30 days in order to continue with the Verily Lightpath program. Until we receive that form, we are not able to communicate via messaging. Thank you\!*  Add ‘Do not message’ to do until member has responded  If member does not sign or does not respond we should not communicate with the person messaging until it has been signed Note: If you identify a language barrier please task VUS to call member using the language line to summarize the Personal Representative Authorization Form and explain the need for it to be signed (ie. Member only speaks Russian and would like wife to communicate for them in English)  Once the form is received through Yosi Clinic staff will leave a note in the Console with the following: Name of authorized person and date of expiration Coach creates a custom to do: Personal Rep Auth Form Expiration in the Console and schedules out 2 weeks before the expiration date to remind the Coach the form is going to expire and a new one will need to be sent. RN **[Athena Basics for Nurse/Care Leads](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1zKDiEPpUWsWGGwO6dT_0bUko2GhSxJIStmg54OVhlQ4/edit?tab=t.0)** See: Member Requesting Medical Records or Personal Auth Representative  |
| Medical Records Release form (request of PHI) | If a member is requesting medical records to be released from the Verily/ Onduo program please follow the steps below. Note: members have access to all lab results ordered by Onduo PC in the Athena portal. However, if they need all records because they are leaving the program, transitioning care, etc they will need to sign a medical records release form.  HC Task RN to open a patient case in Athena requesting the link to the medical records release form be sent to the member vis Yosi Communication to member *Thank you for letting me know that you would like your medical records released. Please be on the lookout for an email notification to complete a form within 30 days to provide permission for us to send your medical records. Thank you\!*  Once the form is received through Yosi Clinic staff will leave a note in the Console with the following: Medical records request form received As part of completing the form, members will indicate how they would like the records sent and where so the coach does not need to obtain those details. In the event a call is received about this, VUS will notify the clinic via patient case to send the form. |

| Self reported Hypo readings | Any self reported hypoglycemia reading below 70 mg/dL  Custom to do: Escalation RN \- hypoglycemia (and reassign to RN) Document in Notes:  Member reported events, symptoms of hypoglycemia: Feeling weak, shaky or lightheaded, sweaty or clammy, feeling irritable, confused or hungry Potential Hypoglycemia Unawareness:  If member’s blood glucose is less than 70 mg/dL confirmed with a fingerstick and the member does not report symptoms associated with hypoglycemia (more detail in Member Reported Symptoms section) Member reported events, any reports of hypoglycemia requiring assistance including: Glucagon required, 911 called, visit to the emergency department or urgent care  |
| Self reported Hyper readings  | Any self-reported hyperglycemia reading above 400 mg/dL. Custom to do: Escalation RN \- hyperglycemia (and reassign to RN) Member reported events of hyperglycemia: polyuria, nocturia, polydipsia or polyphagia, unexplained weight loss, blurred vision, extreme fatigue Member-reported hospitalization for DKA (Diabetes Ketoacidosis), HHS (Hyperosmolar Hyperglycemic State or severe hyperglycemia  |
| Monitoring barriers to checking | Member expresses the following reasons not to fingerstick: Member reports pain with monitoring and current technique from the content is not helping Member reports difficulty getting adequate blood for checking  |
| Follow Up CGM  | Member to benefit from  Phone call with CSR if member is having difficulty with the process of initiating/setting up CGM. Escalation to RN if additional clinical insight needed   |
| CGM adhesive reactions | This is not an escalation initially. Send a content card ‘What to Do for Adhesive Reactions’ and follow the guidance below if more support is needed. **CGM prescribed by Onduo PC**: If further concerns or medications are mentioned, direct the member to send a message to the clinic via the patient portal.  **CGM prescribed outside of Onduo (including PWN MD)**: refer the member back to their local provider.    |
| CGM Sensor Review | Anytime a member is prescribed a CGM trial by Onduo PC they should be escalated to RN after each sensor wear (Note: this does not apply for long term CGMs) RN will review sensors and enter a patient case in Athena for MD review MD will do an async review and indicate in encounter summary if follow up visit is needed |
| CGM Tidepool not connected | If member has received an invitation to Tidepool and they confirm that they started wearing the CGM but data is not in Tidepool Escalate to RN |
| Sensor Placement | This is not an escalation initially. Send content card ‘Finding the Best Place for Your CGM Sensor’ to provide a member with information on where to place the sensor If member needs alternative site for placing sensor or has questions/concerns: Escalate to RN |
| Insulin Pump | If member in T2D program shares they are on Insulin Pump: Escalate to Theresa (so member can be reassigned)  Do not discuss further or ask the member any questions about the pump.  |
